Posted By: Cyberium (1/23/2013 12:24:25 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
To  **psychichobo** You are probably new, so let me explain. Channel was instant speed, it usually cost more than the actual creature's converted mana cost. The effect of being channeled was usually a stand alone spell. Thus creatures with channel served a dual purpose, at sorcery speed they are creatures, at instant speed they are combat tricks and the like.
  
   
Bloodrush can only be used during your attack phase. Bloodrush effects boost the power/toughness of your attacking creature. The bonus is only during your turn. There is less flexibility but it makes up for it with the surprise factor on your opponents face when they take 9 damage instead of 3. Bloodrush is perfect for Gruul, whereas Channel was more about spirits being sacrificed for an effect.
  
   
And Lastly no one respects Kamigawa block. It created a cardtype that was clunky and didnt interact well with other cards ie Arcane. If Arcane was printed as an ability then it would've interacted better but since it was under ... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:
To psychichobo You are probably new, so let me explain. Channel was instant speed, it usually cost more than the actual creature's converted mana cost. The effect of being channeled was usually a stand alone spell. Thus creatures with channel served a dual purpose, at sorcery speed they are creatures, at instant speed they are combat tricks and the like.

Bloodrush can only be used during your attack phase. Bloodrush effects boost the power/toughness of your attacking creature. The bonus is only during your turn. There is less flexibility but it makes up for it with the surprise factor on your opponents face when they take 9 damage instead of 3. Bloodrush is perfect for Gruul, whereas Channel was more about spirits being sacrificed for an effect.

And Lastly no one respects Kamigawa block. It created a cardtype that was clunky and didnt interact well with other cards ie Arcane. If Arcane was printed as an ability then it would've interacted better but since it was under ... (see all)

posts.post_content:
My new rg std beater:  
  
Waif  
Captive  
Mayor  
Mauler  
Emissary  
Kruin   
Rampager  
  
Rancor  
Revenge of the hunted  
2x wrath  
  
4x crag  
9 mt 9 frst  
  
Its based around being too fast to stop. It can get 10 or so dmg in before a verdict hits. Then get a flipped kruin out, rush it and swing for game.   
  
Funny this is the only gruul card that stacks up to the wolves. I was considering rubblebelt as well but its vulnerable and lacks evasion. Oh, the bloodrush snake is pretty tight too. Also thinking of wrecking ogre, just for the bloodrush. Too much mana tho, i like being confident with three lands. Deadbridge can also add some much needed late game. A final thought was domri x 2, but planeswalkers weigh u down in these colors. Also, I pride myself on this being a budget deck, that can be built for about $20 on amazon (provided you have at least a few rancors and crags to start) and it can stand up to decks where literally every single card is about $20. Granted it will die horrible deaths to serenity, bu... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

posts.post_content:
Rampager is bonkers. It's almost like someone said "How can we make [Colossal Might](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name= Colossal Might) better? Why by giving you the option to play it as a 4/4 with trample of course!"  
  
Sure can only play it when you attack, but who cares when your hitting your opponent for 6,7, or 8? Oh and it's a creature with trample when you need it. For four mana. I love bloodrush.  
  
Absolutely love this card. 4.7/5
